name: Ulfric Stormcloak

aspects.high_concept: Jarl of Windhelm and Leader of the Stormcloak Rebellion
aspects.trouble: The Ghost of High King Torygg Haunts Me

stunts: Voice of the High King: +2 to Rapport when inspiring Nords or giving speeches about freedom
Unrelenting Force: Once per scene, use Thu'um to create 'Knocked Down' or 'Disarmed' aspect on target (requires Will vs Physique check)
Great War Survivor: +2 to Will when resisting mental attacks or interrogation
True High King: Can use Rapport instead of Provoke when commanding Stormcloaks
Storm of Rebellion: When leading Stormcloak forces, grant all allies +1 to Fight
notes: Ulfric Stormcloak killed High King Torygg in honorable combat and started a rebellion to free Skyrim from the Empire. A complex figure torn between duty, honor, and ambition. Trained in the Thu'um by the Greybeards but used it in combat, breaking his oath.

relationships.General Tullius: Imperial oppressor who must be defeated
relationships.Jarl Balgruuf: Disappointed ally turned neutral, wants his support
relationships.High King Torygg: Murdered in duel, haunted by the act
relationships.Elenwen: Thalmor torturer from his past, despises her
relationships.The Greybeards: Complicated - broke his oath by using Thu'um in combat
relationships.Brunwulf Free-Winter: Political opponent in Windhelm who questions his policies; potential replacement Jarl if deposed

personality_notes.speaking_style: Passionate and eloquent. Speaks of honor, freedom, and tradition. Can be charismatic or brooding depending on situation.
motivations: Prove he's the rightful High King
Redeem himself for Markarth and Torygg
fears: That he killed Torygg for the wrong reasons
Becoming what the Thalmor wanted him to be - a divider
Skyrim falling to the Thalmor without Empire's protection
Being remembered as a traitor instead of a hero
quirks: Broods on his throne when troubled
Defensive about using Thu'um against Torygg
Conflicted about the path he's chosen

advancement_triggers: Complete critical missions for the rebellion (+1)

initial_meeting.greeting: I am Jarl Ulfric Stormcloak. You stand in the Palace of the Kings. What do you seek?

responses.option: I want to fight for Skyrim's freedom

recruitment_path.dialogue: Good. Skyrim needs strong warriors. Speak with Galmar Stone-Fist. Prove your worth, and you'll have a place in my army.

rebellion_explanation.dialogue: The Empire is weak. They bend to the Thalmor's every whim, ban our worship of Talos, and bleed us dry with taxes. Skyrim must be free to defend itself.

responses.option: The Empire protects us from the Thalmor
I'm with you. Let me join

torygg_defense.dialogue: I challenged Torygg in honorable combat, as is the ancient Nord way. He accepted. I won. Some call it murder - I call it tradition.
torygg_defense.note: Ulfric becomes defensive about this topic

branching_interactions.if_stormcloak: Primary quest giver and faction leader
branching_interactions.if_imperial: Major antagonist, final boss of Imperial questline
branching_interactions.renowned_warrior: Sees accomplished warriors as the champions Skyrim needs

unrelenting_force.mechanics: Will vs Physique check, on success target is knocked down or disarmed
unrelenting_force.note: Ulfric broke his Greybeard oath by using Thu'um in combat

combat_tactics: Fights with sword and Thu'um. Uses Unrelenting Force to control battlefield. Leads from front when necessary but prefers strategic command. Honorable fighter - prefers single combat to ambush.
story_hooks: Tortured by Thalmor during Great War - they manipulated him
Markarth Incident - promised religious freedom then betrayed by Empire
Killed High King Torygg with Thu'um, causing controversy
Broke Greybeard oath by using Voice for violence
Secretly questions if rebellion is what's best for Skyrim
Elenwen has a dossier on him from his torture
Used by Thalmor as unwitting asset to divide Skyrim

dark_secrets.thalmor_dossier: Elenwen has files from his torture and interrogation after Great War. Ulfric doesn't know they consider him an 'asset' for dividing Skyrim.
dark_secrets.torygg_regret: Privately questions if killing Torygg was necessary or if he could have been convinced to rebel
dark_secrets.markarth_shame: Made promises of religious freedom he couldn't keep when Empire retook the city
